fields.summary: VNET_DNS value is not the only DNS IP in resolv.conf

comments.body: reviewing with Tier 3
Requesting Tier 2 verify condition still exists after modifying VNET_CLOUDIP and DNS IP in web UI.

The VNET_ settings in eucalyptus.conf are as following:

VNET_MODE="MANAGED-NOVLAN"
VNET_PRIVINTERFACE="br0"
VNET_PUBINTERFACE="br0"
VNET_BRIDGE="br0"
VNET_PUBLICIPS="192.168.61.110-192.168.61.130"
VNET_SUBNET="10.10.0.0"
VNET_NETMASK="255.255.0.0"
VNET_ADDRSPERNET="32"
VNET_DNS="10.1.1.254"
VNET_LOCALIP="192.168.40.16"
VNET_DHCPDAEMON="/usr/sbin/dhcpd41"

And system DNS settings are as following:

# euca-describe-properties | grep dns
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_dns_delegation	false
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns	false
PROPERTY	system.dns.dnsdomain	eucalyptus-systems.com
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserver	10.1.1.254
PROPERTY	system.dns.registrationid	91738a82-e513-4c99-a178-284e9835859c

So VNET_DNS and system.dns.nameserver both are set to 10.1.1.254

Version of eucalyptus packages:
eucalyptus-common-java-3.1.0-0.0.2654.20120607gitbee3f9b1.1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sc-3.1.0-0.0.2654.20120607gitbee3f9b1.1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-gl-3.1.0-0.0.2654.20120607gitbee3f9b1.1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cloud-3.1.0-0.0.2654.20120607gitbee3f9b1.1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-3.1.0-0.0.2654.20120607gitbee3f9b1.1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cc-3.1.0-0.0.2654.20120607gitbee3f9b1.1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.1.0-0.0.2654.20120607gitbee3f9b1.1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-walrus-3.1.0-0.0.2654.20120607gitbee3f9b1.1.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-nc-3.1.0-0.0.2654.20120607gitbee3f9b1.1.el6.x86_64

Inside the VMs after it has booted:

# cat /etc/resolv.conf 
; generated by /sbin/dhclient-script
search eucalyptus
nameserver 10.1.1.254
nameserver 127.0.0.1

# cat /var/run/eucalyptus/net/euca-dhcp.conf 
# automatically generated config file for DHCP server
default-lease-time 86400;
max-lease-time 86400;
ddns-update-style none;

shared-network euca {
subnet 10.10.169.160 netmask 255.255.255.224 {
  option subnet-mask 255.255.255.224;
  option broadcast-address 10.10.169.191;
  option domain-name "eucalyptus";
  option domain-name-servers 10.1.1.254, 127.0.0.1;
  option routers 10.10.169.161;
}

host node-10.10.169.176 {
  hardware ethernet D0:0D:66:07:47:69;
  fixed-address 10.10.169.176;
}
}

Please let me know if there any questions.

Hi Darren,

Please let me know if any further information is required, as I currently see this as awaiting reply from me.

Cheers!
Deependra

Confirmed.

Tested with 3.1, and /etc/resolv.conf showed VNET_DNS value (which matches the WebUI), and other DNS entry from CC in /etc/resolv.conf.

Question comes around what populates "option domain-name-servers" in /var/run/eucalyptus/net/euca-dhcp.conf?  What mechanism is used to retrieve those values?

Please let me know if there are any additional questions.

Regards,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

Confirmed.

Need more understanding as to how "domain-name-servers" is populated in /var/run/eucalyptus/net/euca-dhcp.conf.

Please let us know if there are any additional questions.

Regards,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

On my DC setup - my instance shows:
{code}

[root@ip-172-17-119-235 etc]# cat resolv.conf 
; generated by /sbin/dhclient-script
search eucalyptus
nameserver 10.1.1.254
nameserver 10.101.1.15
[root@ip-172-17-119-235 etc]# 

{code}

My VNET_DNS and CLC resolve.conf

{code}
VNET_DNS="10.1.1.254"


[root@b-15 ~]# cat /etc/resolv.conf 
; generated by /sbin/dhclient-script
search devtest.eucalyptus-systems.com
nameserver 10.1.1.254
nameserver 8.8.4.4
[root@b-15 ~]# 


{code}

Is the issue that we don't want to configure a secondary nameserver 
on a instance to be assigned to local loopback ?
What networking mode are you using? Managed/Managed-NOVLAN?  Is the CC running on the same machine as the CLC?

MANAGED-NOVLAN. 

CLC+CC+SC+WA all on 1 node.

3.1.2 Data Center installed by SilverEye.
Harold, what are your thoughts here as to why John is seeing different behavior with his setup versus what we see?

It appears to me the the 127.0.0.1 is being sent  from the CLC on 
a StartNetwork() request to the CC. The CC, in vnetGenerateDHCP() uses
that address "euca_ns" to append to the "domain-name-servers" field 
when the dhcp.conf file is created.

Hey John,

Looking at this some more, if a user puts a value in for the following variables in eucalyptus.conf:

VNET_DNS
VNET_CLOUDIP

It looks like they get added to /etc/resolv.conf.  It looks like if you don't put in VNET_CLOUDIP, that it defaults to 127.0.0.1.

If a user doesn't define both of these variables, do we know the default behavior?  

Hope this makes.  Let me know if there are any questions.

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

The issue is sysConf.setNameserverAddress() is never resolved to a actual 
IP address when the property system.dns.nameserver is set, that action is never 
followed by a IP lookup ( host name to  IP string ) so the  value remains 127.0.0.1

The namserver IP was not being exposed . Now it is:

{noformat}
[root@b-15 eucalyptus]#  euca-describe-properties | grep dns
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_dns_delegation	false
PROPERTY	bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns	false
PROPERTY	system.dns.dnsdomain	localhost
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserver	google
PROPERTY	system.dns.nameserveraddress	8.8.8.8

{noformat}

git info



{noformat}
jpdonnelly@b-11 eucalyptus]$ git diff
diff --git a/clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/edu/ucsb/eucalyptus/cloud/entities/S
index 947688f..fdfac2b 100644
--- a/clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/edu/ucsb/eucalyptus/cloud/entities/SystemCo
+++ b/clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/edu/ucsb/eucalyptus/cloud/entities/SystemCo
@@ -98,9 +98,10 @@ public class SystemConfiguration extends AbstractPersistent {
   @ConfigurableField( description = "Domain name to use for DNS." )
   @Column( name = "dns_domain" )
   private String  dnsDomain;
-  @ConfigurableField( description = "Nameserver address." )
+  @ConfigurableField( description = "Nameserver hostname." )
   @Column( name = "nameserver" )
   private String  nameserver;
+  @ConfigurableField( description = "Nameserver ip address." )
   @Column( name = "ns_address" )
   private String  nameserverAddress;


[jpdonnelly@b-11 eucalyptus]$ git commit -m "euca-2281: export system.dns.nameserveraddress" clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/edu/ucsb/eucalyptus/cloud/entities/SystemConfiguration.java
[dev/jpdonnelly/euca-2281 3f61722] euca-2281: export system.dns.nameserveraddress
 1 files changed, 2 insertions(+), 1 deletions(-)
[jpdonnelly@b-11 eucalyptus]$ git submodule foreach git checkout -b de^Cjpdonnelly/euca-2281
[jpdonnelly@b-11 eucalyptus]$ git push origin  dev/jpdonnelly/euca-2281
Counting objects: 27, done.
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (12/12), done.
Writing objects: 100% (14/14), 1.05 KiB, done.
Total 14 (delta 6), reused 0 (delta 0)
To repo-euca@git.eucalyptus-systems.com:eucalyptus
 * [new branch]      dev/jpdonnelly/euca-2281 -> dev/jpdonnelly/euca-2281
[jpdonnelly@b-11 eucalyptus]$ 

{noformat}
See previous comments.

verify result:NOT PASS
release :EUCA3.2
steps:
1)the configuration of eucalytus.conf in euca-mgmt:
#VNET_DHCPUSER="dhcpd"
LOGLEVEL="DEBUG"
NC_WORK_SIZE="4823000"
VNET_SUBNET="192.168.0.0"
VNET_DNS="10.69.152.246"
POWER_IDLETHRESH="0"
DISABLE_DNS="N"
POWER_WAKETHRESH="0"
VNET_ADDRSPERNET="128"
ENABLE_WS_SECURITY="Y"
VNET_NETMASK="255.255.0.0"
DISABLE_ISCSI="N"
NC_CACHE_SIZE="1049000"
VNET_PUBLICIPS="10.69.152.10-10.69.152.220"
2),see euca-describe-properties | grep dns
[root@euca-mgmt-1 ~]# euca-describe-properties | grep dns
PROPERTY        bootstrap.webservices.use_dns_delegation        true
PROPERTY        bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns  true
PROPERTY        system.dns.dnsdomain    ncep153.cd.nsn-rdnet.net
PROPERTY        system.dns.nameserver   10.69.152.246
PROPERTY        system.dns.registrationid       32f883c7-9ae1-4445-b6fc-f4fe38c4ce7d
3),launch a instance and see the /etc/resolve.conf ,there still two DNS ip addr,second one is configure in eucalyptus.conf
[root@euca-192-168-253-143 ~]# cat /etc/resolv.conf 
; generated by /sbin/dhclient-script
search eucalyptus eucalyptus.internal
nameserver 10.69.152.246
nameserver 10.69.153.6
The change allows an accurate setting of the second DNS. It typically shows up as 127.0.0.1

Hi Vivi.

This fix is in review, the targeted version for the fix is 3.2.1.

Thanks.

{noformat}

Can someone please outline the exact parameters that now set the DNS parameters within the instance.

Are they both in the eucalyptus.conf? 

Which should be shown first within the instance?

The secondary DNS will be defined by what the new property "system.dns.nameserveraddress" is set to . It has never been exposed thus it defaults 
to 127.0.0.1.

I was wondering if the is an old method of configuration that was obsoleted  using eucalyptus.conf's  VNET_DNS ?
John, Ken reviewed and approved this one.  Please go ahead and commit.  Thanks.
Reviewed by Ken.

Was able to change the property from the default of 127.0.0.1 to 8.8.8.8 and launch an instance that properly showed the value set in VNET_DNS and the cloud property:

root@ip-172-30-33-251:~# cat /etc/resolv.conf 
nameserver 192.168.7.1
nameserver 8.8.8.8
domain eucalyptus
search eucalyptus
root@ip-172-30-33-251:~#
